intro: Matelea palustris, commonly known as swamp matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to reddish-orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in wetlands and moist soils, often in swampy or marshy areas. Its foliage consists of opposite, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
